result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Henry Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with V. Torres unless allowed by supervising agent.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Henry Ortiz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 9:54 am case called. Defendant Aaron Henry Ortiz in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader regarding an amended complaint being filed. Court questions defendant regarding address. Court questions the defendant regarding counsel. Defendant would like to speak with the District Attorney. Statement by DA Blader. Resolution reached and stated on the record.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No Statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Imposes 90 days WCJ. If revoked with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 1 day Served. STAYED and places on probation for a period of 1 year. CONDITIONS:    The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and follow through. Terms of Agent. No Contact with V. Torres unless allowed by agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample to be provided. Appeal Rights Given.

ADDRESS INFO for Aaron Henry Ortiz
Current: 322 S Brooklyn Street, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 05-19-2015)
Prior: 223 South Brooklyn St, Berlin, WI 54923

Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

1:13 pm case called. Defendant Aaron Henry Ortiz in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Aaron Henry Ortiz in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint stated-reading waived.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 09:40 am.
